ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: sure. Not that we have a choice

A very hands on course that teaches how basics of astronomical instrumentation, how to prepare and run an observation, and after that reduce and analyze obtained data. Recommended to other students as well because it is well taught, with appropriate workload and covering topics which every astronomer, both observational and theoretical, should be familiar with.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This was a great introduction to many of the tools and processes involved in being an observational astronomer. It seems that many things in astronomy are simply left for you to discover, so getting a head start on what those things even are is a great help.
I haven't yet decided on my dissertation topic, but the course was very helpful and put to good use in an observing run I've just been to.
